snippet: Investigators say the quest for a counterfeit-proof driver's license has spurred a black market in which state workers issue fraudulent licenses in return for bribes of $200 to $1,000 each.    The California Department of Motor Vehicles fears that...
lead_paragraph: Investigators say the quest for a counterfeit-proof driver's license has spurred a black market in which state workers issue fraudulent licenses in return for bribes of $200 to $1,000 each. The California Department of Motor Vehicles fears that at least 25,000 fraudulently issued licenses are on the street. Seventy-nine employees have been dismissed in the last 19 months, and investigators estimate that 250 of the department's 8,000 employees may be involved in the scam.
abstract: California Department of Motor Vehicles fears state workers have issued about 25,000 fraudulent driver's licenses in return for bribes; 79 employees have been dismissed in last 19 months, and investigators estimate that 250 of department's 8,000 employees may be involved in scam; California driver's license is basic identification document; increased difficulty of counterfeiting them means that people unable to obtain them legitimately are turning to bribery of clerks to get license (M)

headline.main: Fake Licenses Tied to Bribes In California
